data.title: Dusty on HubPages
data.meta_description: I hold an BS degree in Business Administration and a Master's in theology. I work in records management for a mental health clinic and spend my off...
data.text:
Big City Boy Falls in Love with Small Town Girl

The quiet serenty of a small town and especially one of its local girls captivates a big city playboy

Singin' in the Rain - When Movies Learned to Talk

Set in 1927 when silent movies gave way to talkies, this movie takes us on a wonderful ride though that process with some romance, comedy, song and dance added to produce a joyful delight.

East Meets West in Silk Stockings

When a Russian Commisar comes to Paris to retrieve a wayward comrade she has no idea that she will fall in love with an American Capitalist.

Lady on a Train Comedy, Noir and Christmas Wrapped up into One

Nikki loves murder mysteries, and when she sees a murder take place she goes into sleuth mode with comedic results.

Repeat Performance. Is It Deja Vu All Over Again?

Sheila kills her husband on New Year's Eve and immediately regrets it. She wishes for a do over for the entire year and gets it. Will the new New Year be any different?

The Bishop's Wife - a Heavenly Visitation

When Dudley shows up to be the Bishop's assistant, the Bishop has no idea of how he will help or just how wonderfully he will fulfill his assigned tasks.

What is the Trouble with Harry?

Harry is dead and there are a few people in town who think they might be the culprit. What really happened?

Local Politics Turned Upside Down When There's A Stranger in Town

When a Supreme Court Justice on vacation gets caught up in the political corruption of a small town he sets them straight!

Peyton Place, Ripping off the Veneer of a Quiet New England Town

A peaceful town hides dark secrets and it is not as it seems.

Feel the Heat in The Long Hot Summer

A drifter with a bad reputation comes to town and confronts the town boss who responds by getting the drifter to marry his daughter.

Cat on a Hot Tin Roof: A Family Grapples With the Difficulties of Life

A strong willed man and his son struggle to find common ground while discovering that "mendacity is the world in which we live".

Show Boat on Ol' Man River

Good times and hard times; love and romance; it's all rollin' on old man river.

Brigadoon - A Once per Hundred Year Fantasy Village

An American hunter finds himself wrapped in a romance, but lost in a fantasy village in the Scottish Highlands.

Footlight Parade - Busby Berkeley's Pinnacle of Dance

Chester Kent, a driven man, works more than ever to stage prologues in theaters and proves to doubters that it can be done.

Gold Diggers of 1933 a Powerful Statement of Its Time

During the Great Depression a group of eager actors makes a statement about the times in which they live. They have fun and score a big hit.

Fred and Ginger Romance and Dance in Swing Time

Romance is in the air and on the dance floor as Lucky and Penny meet, fight, fall in love and dance their way into the hearts of all who watch.

It Started With Eve - a Ruse Gone Right?

An man's innocent ruse causes life-changing fortune for a woman's career and helps bring his father from the brink of death, but drives his fiance away.

Holiday Affair - A Love Triangle at Christmastime

Steve and Carl both fight for Connie's hand, not with each other, but with the ghost of her past.

A Man and His Companion - The Story of Harvey

Elwood P. Dowd is a very nice man, and he would be more than willing to introduce you to his best friend, Harvey

Keys to the Movie: Key Largo

A war hero comes to a quiet hotel in the Florida keys and confronts a notorious gangster - who will prevail?

Wake up With The Big Sleep

A private eye confuses everyone and saves a beautiful woman or two from a crime they might have committed. Who knows?

To Have and Have Not: Adventure in the Caribbean

Casablanca - You Must Remember This

A neutral man in an unneutral world finds an old love whose very presence helps him step back into a fight for freedom during World War II.

Be Driven Mad Watching Gaslight

When a romance turns sinister and a husband's quest for jewels haunts his wife nearly into madness a detective comes to the rescue and restores her sanity.

Love Letters - The Power of the Pen Over the Hearts of the Romantic

Can mere letters inflame the heart? Can love overcome amnesia? Watch and find out.

Cluny Brown - A Beautiful Plumber Looking to Find Her Place

All her life Cluny Brown has been fascinated with the plumbing trade, but everyone else has told her to forget it and that she really needs to learn her place. Then one day a handsome stranger comes into her life and tells her that she can determine her own place in this world.

The Quiet Man - Anything but a Quiet Movie

A romantic comedy with cross cultural appeal

Arsenic and Old Lace - Comedy With a Little Horror Mixed In

Mortimer discovers horrible secrets about his sweet family on his wedding day and needs to settle things before his honeymoon.

Bringing Up Baby, an Excellent Screwball Comedy

What happens when a paleontologist is mistaken for a zoologist and winds up chasing a leopard in Connecticut? Watch it and find out.

Enjoy the Season with Christmas in Connecticut

A writer and a war hero are unexpectedly pushed together in an elaborate ruse to the comedic delight or all during the Christmas holiday.

By Way of Introduction: Meet John Doe

A newspaper column takes a nobody and starts a grass roots political movement.

Mr. Smith Goes to Washington - an Apparently Timeless Story

An innocent and naive man comes to Washington and unwittingly directs the Senate back to its original purpose.

Picnic - a Labor Day Tale

It's Labor Day, 1955 in Kansas. A drifter comes to town and has an effect on the town, especially its women - it's turns out to be quite a hot day in more ways than one.

Kings Row, a Town Both Idyllic and Sinister

In a small midwestern town, during the Victorian age life seemed perfect, but was it? What mysteries and dark secrets are hidden beneath that idyllic veneer? Watch Kings Row to learn.

Putting an Outlaw on the 3:10 to Yuma

Dan Evans has something to prove. He needs to put the outlaw Ben Wade on a train: the 3:10 to Yuma to face justice. But it's easier said than done.

The Oil Boom in "Tulsa"

The oil boom in Tulsa made and broke people who gambled on the chance to have oil on their property. This is the story about one woman who won that gamble, but nearly lost her soul.

The Magic of the Enchanted Cottage

A young couple, homely and disfigured, find that their cottage magically beautifies them. It does not adjust their appearance, but their perception of each other.

The Magical Music Man Movie

Can a con artist really help a town?

Lonely People Sit at Separate Tables

Lonely people develop a community of their own

Random Harvest - Love Conquers All

Through two types of amnesia their love is imperishable

What's on the Menu of The Man Who Came to Dinner?

He came for dinner, stayed for weeks and changed a household

What Happened in "It Happened on Fifth Avenue"?

A Christmas time "dramedy" which shows us how the poor of this world can be richer than the wealthy.

Pandora and the Flying Dutchman - The Legend Comes Alive

Pandora yearns for a man she hasn't met. Will a legend hundreds of years old bring him to her? And will it cost her life?

The Haunting Romance of the the Ghost and Mrs. Muir

A widow falls in love again, but is the new man a ghost or just a dream?

What's Buried in the "Five Graves to Cairo"?

Somewhere in the North African Desert during World War II there were five graves which held within them secrets that could win the war.

The Tale of the Four Feathers

A tale of redemption from cowardice to heroism.

What's so good about Bad Day at Black Rock?

A mysterious stranger comes to town, but the town is not what it seems; it is a town that has a dark secret and wants to hide it from him. But the stranger is not what he seems either. Will he find the terrible secret; will he prevail against the town?

The Mystery of the Woman in White

The Secret Garden, Unlocking It's Mystery

A children's movie with adult lessons to be learned. A secret walled garden locked shut for 10 years reveals a story a tale of woe and provides an opportunity for redemption.

The Harvey Girls - a Musical Movie From the Old West

In the old west, along the railroads a restaurant chain developed to meet the needs of the travelers. The waitresses were a civilizing influence on the frontier. This musical depicts how it may have been in those days.

Looking in the Window at The Shop Around the Corner

Personal ads and retail combine to make for a delightful tale in the Shop Around the Corner

'Rear Window' Review - Looking In

So much can be seen by looking out of an apartment window. This is the story of L.B. Jeffries and what he sees out of his rear window. This is a story of the many lives of his neighbors and the death of one of them.

The First Fully Colorized Movie

In 1935 Hollywood came out with it's first fully colorized movie. This was a dramatization of Thackeray's novel, Vanity Fair and took its name from the lead character - Becky Sharp.

Welcome to "The Inn of the Sixth Happiness": A Film Analysis

One woman whose faith guided her footsteps to a lifetime of service far from home. This is the story of Gladys Aylward, a missionary to China.

The Scarlet Letter - an Old American Classic

In seventeenth century America some clashes of morality hid themselves for a while then were found out. Was the cause of righteousness served?

A Look at Algiers the Movie

Algiers is a city with a secretive place called the Casbah and it has become a sanctuary for a beloved crime boss. Can the law penetrate the Casbah and apprehend their man?
